div.div: Semivariogram showing the spatial autocorrelation structure of the climatic variables.

div.p: Click here for additional data file.

div.div: Wild boar hunting bags and traffic accidents involving wild boar.
div.p: Comparison between annual wild boar hunting bags and the number of traffic accidents involving wild boar as well as between the relative change in the hunting bag and the relative change in traffic accidents. The illustrated findings justify the use of wild boar hunting bags as a proxy for population size, since traffic accidents can be regarded as a random sampling of population size.
Click here for additional data file.

div.div: Importance of climatic variables according to a ‘random forest’ analysis.

div.p: Click here for additional data file.

div.div: Overview over the wild boar hunting bag data from all regions included in the analysis.
div.p: For each region the area [km²], the earliest and the latest hunting bag data point, the minimum and the maximum hunting bag, the long-term (1973–2002) winter mean temperature is shown, as well as sources of the hunting bag data.
Click here for additional data file.

div.div: Overview over the climatic data from all regions included in the analysis.
div.p: For each region the number and the name of the climate station used are given as well as the latitude, longitude, and altitude of the respective station. Further, the year of the oldest data point for monthly mean temperature and monthly precipitation sum is given as well as the source of the data.
Click here for additional data file.

div.div: Model-averaged parameters estimates and standard errors for the European and the Austrian multi-model average are given.
div.p: These results have been obtained using the zero method and are given in comparison to Table 1 showing the results obtained with the natural-average method.
Click here for additional data file.

div.div: Spatial and temporal autocorrelation analysis of the residuals of the European multi-model average, including the spatio-temporal semivariogram of the residuals (Figure A) and the bootstrapped spatial autocorrelation structure of the residuals (Figure B).

div.p: Click here for additional data file.
